properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing loonie-sized hail and wind gusts in excess of 90 km/h. At 4:42 PM CST Doppler RADAR indicated that this severe thunderstorm was located about 15 km southeast of Wood Mountain and was moving toward the northeast at 30 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2020-07-07T01:42:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-06T22:44:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2570853917.2020
Area: R.M. of Old Post including Wood Mountain and Killdeer
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing quarter-sized hail and wind gusts in excess of 90 km/h. At 6:30 PM CST Doppler RADAR indicated that this severe thunderstorm was located about 15 km east of Assiniboia and was moving toward the northeast at 30 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2020-07-07T02:37:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-07T00:35:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0787381591.2020
Area: R.M. of Lake of The Rivers including Assiniboia, R.M. of Excel including Viceroy Ormiston and Verwood
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heat event continues tonight. Low temperatures will range from 16 to 18 degrees Celsius tonight. Although daily high temperatures will continue reaching near 29 degrees Celsius for much of the week, Heat Warning criteria is not expected to be met due to the relief provided by cooler overnight lows. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-07T12:07:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-06T20:08:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0329079637.2020
Area: Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heat event continues through the end of the week. Inland from the Great Lakes, daytime high temperatures near 29 degrees Celsius will accompany humidex values in the low to mid thirties through the next several days. Overnight low temperatures in the mid to upper teens are also expected during this period. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. Never leave people or pets inside a parked vehicle. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-07T11:49:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-06T19:50:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0765295709.2020
Area: Blind River - Thessalon, Espanola - Killarney, Manitoulin Island

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:04 PM EDT weather radar and lightning detector indicated isolated intense thunderstorms capable of producing large hail, and damaging wind gusts up to 90-100 km/h. These storms are located near Calstock and Fraserdale and are moving northeast at 50 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-07T03:26:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-07T00:28:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0841524617.2020

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heat event continues. Inland from Lake Superior, daytime high temperatures near 30 degrees Celsius are occurring. Overnight low temperatures will drop into the mid teens tonight. A cold front is expected to move through the area on Tuesday, bringing cooler air into the region. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Update To Civil Emergency Alert Issued By Government Of Saskatchewan
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the Civil Emergency Alert issued by the Government of Saskatchewan. The state of emergency in Saskatchewan remains in effect. UPDATE: Effective July 6, additional allowable services and activities of Phase 4.2 of Re-Open Saskatchewan are: indoor sports and activities, indoor pools and rinks and performing arts. The Northwest Region remains restricted as Re-Open Saskatchewan proceeds. Go to the Saskatchewan COVID website listed in the instructions for a complete list of allowable services and activities in the Northwest Region. During all Phases of Re-Open Saskatchewan all public health orders, which includes physical distancing by at least two metres from others, is to be followed and applied in all public and private gatherings.
Expires: 2020-07-13T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-07-06T16:07:30-06:00, D61D6BCC-08D8-9838-28CF-90124F4EB0D6
Area: Province of Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:29 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to ping pong ball size hail and torrential rain. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of hot weather will continue through the rest of this week. Daytime high temperatures in excess of 31 degrees Celsius, with humidex values in the high thirties to low forties, are expected this week. Overnight lows near or in excess of 21 degrees Celsius are also expected through this period, providing little relief from the heat. A slightly cooler airmass may move into the area this weekend, however there is considerable uncertainty. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. Never leave people or pets inside a parked vehicle. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-07T11:36:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-06T19:37:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3433229242.2020
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An extreme heat wave is expected this week. A warm and humid air mass over Southern Quebec will persist over the next few days. Beginning Tuesday, temperatures will exceed the 30-degree mark during the day and shouldn't drop below 20 degrees at night. Temperatures combined with humidity will give humidex values of 40. These conditions may persist until Friday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-07T11:44:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-06T19:45:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1384023118.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms have developed, and some have become severe. More thunderstorms are expected to become severe and persist through this evening. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-07T08:59:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-07T00:45:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3944649176.2020

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times. Thunderstorms are expected late this afternoon and early evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:53 p.m. EST (6:53 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking an area of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Hazards: - Heavy rain in excess of 75 mm leading to flash flooding - Isolated wind gusts that may cause damage Locations impacted include: Arrow Lake Provincial Park, Whitefish Lake, Maraboeuf Lake, Gunflint Lake, Northern Light Lake, Mountain Lake, Remicks, Moose Lake, Mackies, North Fowl Lake, South Fowl Lake and Nolalu. This large area of thunderstorms is located from Northern Light Lake to South Fowl Lake. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-07T02:24:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-06T22:54:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2150237100.2020

Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Hazards: - Heavy rain that may lead to flash flooding - Damaging wind gusts to 90 km/h - Nickel to toonie sized hail Locations: Portions of northwestern Ontario including Thunder Bay, Atikokan and Upsala. Timing: This evening. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:18 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to ping pong ball size hail and torrential rain. This storm is located just southeast of Nanton and is heading to the southeast at 15 km/h. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.
Expires: 2020-07-07T03:29:17-00:00

This storm is located 5 km west of Nanton and is heading to the east at 20 km/h. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:02 p.m. EST (7:02 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking an area of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Hazards: - Heavy rain in excess of 75 mm leading to flash flooding - Isolated wind gusts that may cause damage Locations impacted include: La Verendrye Provincial Park, Kashabowie Provincial Park, Arrow Lake Provincial Park, Whitefish Lake, Kakabeka Falls Provincial Park, Kakabeka Falls and Silver Falls Provincial Park. This large area of thunderstorms is located from east of Atikokan to Kakabeka Falls and south. These thunderstorms are moving east at 30 km/h. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-07T02:24:00-00:00
